notifications.title: Timer is complete!
notifications.oneMinuteStartTime: Next you'll remove your swab from the tube.
notifications.tenMinuteStartTime: Next you'll remove your test strip from the tube.
notifications.connectionError: It looks like your {{device}} is disconnected at the moment. To send your data, please open the app again when you are connected and tap "Try Again."
notifications.resetAppAlertBody:
Do you want to restart the test with a different kit?

Saying Yes will reset the app.

emailEntry.emailRequired: Please enter your email to continue.
emailEntry.emailInvalid: That doesn't appear to be a valid email address. Please try again.

ContactSupport.title: Contact Support
ContactSupport.description: Contact us with study questions or problems with the test procedure, kit contents, or the flu@home app. The email address and phone number will be monitored for 6 months after study completion.

Welcome.title: Welcome
Welcome.desc:
We know you aren't feeling well right now. Thank you for participating even when you're sick.*

With your help, we want to understand if people (like you) can test themselves at home for the flu. But first, we'll walk you through a few things.
Welcome.desc2: * You must be enrolled in the Achievement --Home Testing of Respiratory Illness-- study to participate. [Tap here if you are not enrolled.](PUSHNAVIGATE:NotEnrolledInStudy)

ScanInstructions.title: Scan the barcode
ScanInstructions.desc:
Locate the barcode on the outside of the flu@home test kit in the top right corner.

The next screen will ask for access to your camera to scan the barcode.

If your kit doesn't have a barcode, [contact support](CONTACTSUPPORT).

barcode.invalidBarcode: {{barcode}} doesn't look like a flu@home kit barcode. Please try again.
barcode.barcodeRequired: Please enter your kit's barcode to continue.
barcode.dontMatch: Those barcodes don't match. Please try again.

BarcodeScanner.instructions:
Position barcode in middle of outline above.
Try adjusting distance or angle if scan is taking a while.

ManualEntry.title: Enter your barcode
ManualEntry.desc: Enter the code found below the barcode symbol on the top right corner of your flu@home test kit.  **(Just enter 10 letters or numbers)**

BarcodeContactSupport.title: Invalid barcode
BarcodeContactSupport.desc: We're sorry, but the barcode you entered ({{barcode}}) did not match our records.
BarcodeContactSupport.desc2: If you are still having trouble, [contact support](CONTACTSUPPORT).

BarcodeConnectionToServerError.title: Connect to verify your barcode
BarcodeConnectionToServerError.desc: We could not connect to verify your barcode. Once you are connected, please come back to the app and try again.

EmailConfirmation.title: Verify your email
EmailConfirmation.desc:
Now let's confirm that your kit (barcode {{barcode}}) matches your Achievement account.

Enter the email address you use for Achievement. Here is a hint:

**{{emailHint}}**

**(Enter any email address, it doesn't matter)

EmailError.title: Cannot verify email
EmailError.desc:
Your kit barcode {{barcode}} and email address {{enteredEmail}} did not match an Achievement account on record.

You can re-enter your email, or if you think you've grabbed the wrong kit, you can scan a different kit barcode. Select an option below to try again.
EmailError.desc2: If you are still having trouble, [contact support](CONTACTSUPPORT).

Swab.title: Prepare Test 1 tube
Swab.desc:
Carefully twist open the saline vial.
Squeeze the liquid carefully into the tube so that all the liquid gets into the tube.

++tip0.description: You may be able to spread flu to others even before you feel sick. You may be contagious 1 day before, and up to 5-7 days after becoming sick.

++tip1.description: Germs are often spread when a person touches something that is contaminated with germs and then touches his or her eyes, nose, or mouth.

++tip2.description: CDC estimates that many antibiotic prescriptions for acute respiratory infections (including the flu) are unnecessary because most are caused by viruses. Viruses do not respond to antibiotics.

++tip3.description: The most important step in preventing flu is to get a flu vaccination each year. CDC recommends that you get vaccinated by the end of October.

++tip4.description: There are antiviral drugs that can be used to treat the flu in the first couple days of your illness. You can only get them by prescription.

++tip5.description: On average, about 8% of the U.S. population gets sick from flu each season.

++tip6.description: Experts believe that the flu spreads mainly by tiny droplets made when people with flu cough, sneeze, or talk. These droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people nearby.

++tip7.description: Complications of flu can include bacterial pneumonia, ear infections, sinus infections and worsening of chronic medical conditions, such as congestive heart failure, asthma, or diabetes.

++tip8.description: Everyday preventive actions (like staying away from people who are sick, covering coughs and sneezes, and frequent handwashing) help slow the spread of the flu.

++tip9.description: Seasonal flu activity often begins as early as October and November and can continue to occur as late as May. It most commonly peaks in the U.S. between December and February.

Unpacking.title: Set up your kit box
Unpacking.desc:
Open the kit box.
Remove the two bags from the pouch on the kit lid and set them aside.
Pick up the small bag from the left (Test 1) side of the box.
Remove the saline vial and tube.
Remove the stopper from the tube.
Stand up the tube in the small hole.

StripInTube.title: Put test strip in tube
StripInTube.desc:
The arrows on the test strip should be **pointing down** as you lower it into the tube. Make sure the strip is touching the liquid in the bottom.
Leave the test strip in the tube. It needs to be there for at least 10 minutes. We will let you know when to take it out.
In the meantime, please answer some questions so we can better understand how this illness has affected you.

Timer.title: Please wait for timer
Timer.desc:
Thank you for completing the survey.

Your test strip is still processing. When the timer ends, the app will direct you to the next step.

TestStripReady.title: Remove test strip
TestStripReady.desc:
Remove the test strip from the tube.
Place the test strip in the middle of the kit box with the arrows pointing down towards you.
Put the grey stopper securely back on the tube.

RDTInstructions.title: Scan your test strip
RDTInstructions.desc: Next, the app will use your camera to scan your test strip. Please note the instructions below.
RDTInstructions.instructions: Ensure your test strip is in the middle of the kit box.
RDTInstructions.instructions2: Hold your {{device}} flat and directly above your test strip.
RDTInstructions.desc2: If the test strip doesn't scan within {{rdtTimeoutSeconds}} seconds, you will be asked to take a photo of it using the app.

NonRDTInstructions.title: Take photo of test strip
NonRDTInstructions.desc: Next, we'd like you to take a photo of your test strip using your {{device}}'s camera. The app will access the camera for you.
NonRDTInstructions.instructions: Ensure your test strip is in the middle of the kit box.
NonRDTInstructions.instructions2: Hold your {{device}} flat and directly above your test strip.
NonRDTInstructions.instructions3: Tap the round button on the screen to take a photo.

RDTReader.alertDesc: Tap "Start" after your camera is focused on the test strip. The app will take multiple pictures during the scanning process.
RDTReader.centerStrip: Hold your {{device}} flat and directly above the test strip
RDTReader.underExposed: Turn on the flash or move to better lighting
RDTReader.overExposed: Ensure test strip is on the kit box and avoid glare from bright lights

CameraSettings.title: Camera access required
CameraSettings.desc:
We're sorry, but using your {{device}}'s camera is required to continue with the test. If you'd like to continue, please update your settings.

**How to Update:**
CameraSettings.howToIOS:
**Go to Settings / Privacy / Camera / flu@home.**
**Flip the switch to "Yes".**
**Please note: When you return, the camera will be active.**
CameraSettings.howToAndroid:
**Go to Settings / Apps / flu@home / Permissions.**
**Toggle the camera switch to on.**
**Please note: When you return, the camera will be active.**

TestStripCamera.title: Tap the screen to focus the image.
TestStripCamera.description: Tap the button below to take a photo
TestStripCamera.alertTitle: We are unable to scan the test strip
TestStripCamera.alertDesc: The app is having trouble scanning your test strip. Please take a photo of the strip.
TestStripCamera.cameraErrorDesc: We are unable to load the camera and will proceed without taking a photo.
TestStripCamera.error: There was a processing error, please try again

TestStripConfirmation.title: Test strip captured
TestStripConfirmation.descManual: Your test strip photo was captured successfully.
TestStripConfirmation.descScanned: Your test strip was scanned successfully.
TestStripConfirmation.diagnosis: [Demo Mode only] Your test result is {{ testResult }}.

Thanks.title: All done!
Thanks.desc:
Thank you for participating in this research study and helping us find better ways to manage the flu. We hope you feel better soon. If you are concerned about your symptoms, contact your healthcare provider or [search for urgent care clinics nearby.](https://www.google.com/maps/search/urgent+care+clinics+{{city}}+{{state}})

Learn more about influenza below with information from Centers for Disease Control (CDC).

PendingData.title: Connect to upload data
PendingData.desc:
We could not connect to upload your data. Once you are connected, please come back to the app and try again.

It may take a minute to sync your data.

links.notEnrolledInStudy: Tap here if you are not enrolled
links.CDC: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: Antiviral drugs may be an option
links.skipTestStripPhoto: Unable to take a picture? Skip this step
